DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Reuse Template Observation Outcome Subcategory Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded value specifying a subdivision within a larger category of an adverse event. EXAMPLE(S): neurologic.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Reuse Template Observation Outcome Subcategory Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._A subdivision that has common differentiating characteristics within a larger category.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Adverse Event Reuse Template Observation Outcome
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.

Property.preferredDefinition: A subdivision that has common differentiating characteristics within a larger category.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: A subdivision that has common differentiating characteristics within a larger category.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Reference concept defined by a referenced code system.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
